title: Relates to establishing the New York state seniors trust fund and directing certain moneys to be deposited into such fund
summary: Relates to establishing the New York state seniors trust fund and directing certain moneys to be deposited into such fund.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          126

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  DIAZ  --  read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Finance

       AN ACT to amend the state finance law, the tax law, the abandoned  prop-
         erty  law  and the civil practice law and rules, in relation to estab-
         lishing the New York state seniors trust fund  and  directing  certain
         moneys to be deposited into such fund

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The state finance law is amended by adding  a  new  section
    2  99-t to read as follows:
    3    S  99-T.  NEW YORK STATE SENIORS TRUST FUND. 1. THERE IS HEREBY ESTAB-
    4  LISHED IN THE JOINT CUSTODY OF THE STATE COMPTROLLER AND THE COMMISSION-
    5  ER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE A FUND TO BE KNOWN  AS  THE  NEW  YORK  STATE
    6  SENIORS TRUST FUND.
    7    2.  SUCH FUND SHALL CONSIST OF ALL MONEYS APPROPRIATED FOR THE PURPOSE
    8  OF SUCH FUND AND ALL MONEYS TRANSFERRED TO SUCH FUND PURSUANT TO SECTION
    9  SIX HUNDRED TWENTY-NINE-A OF THE TAX LAW.
   10    3. MONEYS OF SUCH FUND SHALL BE AVAILABLE FOR APPROPRIATION AND  ALLO-
   11  CATION  ONLY  UPON APPROVAL OF THE DIRECTOR OF THE NEW YORK STATE OFFICE
   12  FOR THE AGING, FOR ALL COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE  FUNDING  OF  THE  HOME
   13  DELIVERED  MEALS  PROGRAM  ADMINISTERED BY THE NEW YORK STATE OFFICE FOR
   14  THE AGING.
   15    4. THE MONEYS OF THE FUND SHALL BE PAID OUT ON THE AUDIT  AND  WARRANT
   16  OF  THE COMPTROLLER ON VOUCHERS CERTIFIED OR APPROVED BY THE DIRECTOR OF
   17  THE NEW YORK STATE OFFICE FOR THE AGING OR HIS OR  HER  DULY  DESIGNATED
   18  REPRESENTATIVE.
   19    S  2.  The tax law is amended by adding a new section 629-a to read as
   20  follows:
   21    S 629-A. GIFT FOR NEW YORK STATE SENIORS TRUST FUND. EFFECTIVE FOR ANY
   22  TAX YEAR COMMENCING ON OR AFTER JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND  TWELVE,  AN
   23  INDIVIDUAL  IN  ANY TAXABLE YEAR MAY ELECT TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE NEW YORK
   24  STATE SENIORS TRUST FUND FOR THE COST ASSOCIATED WITH THE FUNDING OF THE
   25  HOME DELIVERED MEALS PROGRAM ADMINISTERED BY THE NEW YORK  STATE  OFFICE

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03247-01-1

       S. 126                              2

    1  FOR THE AGING. THE CONTRIBUTION SHALL BE ONE DOLLAR AND SHALL NOT REDUCE
    2  THE  AMOUNT OF STATE TAX OWED BY SUCH INDIVIDUAL. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL
    3  INCLUDE SPACE ON THE PERSONAL INCOME TAX RETURN TO ENABLE A TAXPAYER  TO
    4  MAKE  SUCH  CONTRIBUTION. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW ALL
    5  REVENUES COLLECTED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL BE CREDITED TO THE NEW
    6  YORK STATE SENIORS TRUST FUND AND USED ONLY FOR THOSE  PURPOSES  ENUMER-
    7  ATED IN SECTION NINETY-NINE-T OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW.
    8    S  3.  Subdivision 4 of section 1315 of the abandoned property law, as
    9  amended by section 2 of part II of chapter 57 of the laws  of  2010,  is
   10  amended to read as follows:
   11    4.  Any  amount  representing  an  unpaid check or draft issued by the
   12  state of New York which shall have remained unpaid after one  year  from
   13  the  date  of issuance in accordance with section one hundred two of the
   14  state finance law shall be deemed abandoned property and shall  be  paid
   15  to  the  state  comptroller,  PROVIDED, HOWEVER, ANY AMOUNT DEEMED TO BE
   16  ABANDONED PROPERTY PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION, WHICH HAD  BEEN  ISSUED
   17  TO  A  PERSON  SIXTY-FIVE YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER, SHALL BE DEPOSITED INTO
   18  THE NEW YORK STATE SENIORS TRUST FUND ESTABLISHED  PURSUANT  TO  SECTION
   19  NINETY-NINE-T OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW.
   20    S  4.  Subdivision  1  of section 300 of the abandoned property law is
   21  amended by adding a new paragraph (a-1) to read as follows:
   22    (A-1) ANY AMOUNTS DETERMINED TO  BE  ABANDONED  PROPERTY  PURSUANT  TO
   23  PARAGRAPH  (A)  OF  THIS  SUBDIVISION,  WHICH  WERE ENTITLED TO A PERSON
   24  SIXTY-FIVE YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER, SHALL BE DEPOSITED INTO THE  NEW  YORK
   25  STATE  SENIORS  TRUST FUND ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO SECTION NINETY-NINE-T
   26  OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW.
   27    S 5. Subdivision (c) of section 904 of  the  civil  practice  law  and
   28  rules,  as  added by chapter 207 of the laws of 1975, is amended to read
   29  as follows:
   30    (c) The content of the notice shall  be  subject  to  court  approval,
   31  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THAT  IN  ACTION  SEEKING A MONETARY JUDGMENT, SUCH
   32  NOTICE SHALL INCLUDE A SPACE TO  ENABLE  THE  MEMBER  OF  THE  CLASS  TO
   33  CONTRIBUTE  THE PORTION OF THE MONETARY JUDGMENT TO WHICH THEY ARE ENTI-
   34  TLED TO THE NEW YORK STATE SENIORS TRUST FUND. In determining the method
   35  by which notice is to be given, the court shall consider
   36    I. the cost of giving notice by each method considered
   37    II. the resources of the parties and
   38    III. the stake of each represented member of the class, and the  like-
   39  lihood  that  significant numbers of represented members would desire to
   40  exclude themselves from the class or to appear individually,  which  may
   41  be  determined, in the court's discretion, by sending notice to a random
   42  sample of the class.
   43    S 6. The civil practice law and rules  is  amended  by  adding  a  new
   44  section 905-a to read as follows:
   45    S  905-A.  CONTRIBUTIONS  TO  THE  NEW  YORK STATE SENIORS TRUST FUND.
   46  WHERE A MONETARY JUDGMENT HAS BEEN AWARDED TO A CLASS, AND A  MEMBER  OR
   47  MEMBERS  OF SUCH CLASS CHOOSES TO CONTRIBUTE THE PORTION OF THE JUDGMENT
   48  TO WHICH THEY ARE ENTITLED TO THE NEW  YORK  STATE  SENIORS  TRUST  FUND
   49  PURSUANT  TO  SUBDIVISION (C) OF SECTION NINE HUNDRED FOUR OF THIS ARTI-
   50  CLE, ALL SUCH MONIES SHALL BE DEPOSITED INTO THE NEW YORK STATE  SENIORS
   51  TRUST  FUND  ESTABLISHED  IN  SECTION NINETY-NINE-T OF THE STATE FINANCE
   52  LAW.
   53    S 7. This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day  after  it  shall
   54  have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the state finance law, the tax law, the abandoned property law and the civil practice law and rules, in relation to establishing the New York state seniors trust fund and directing certain moneys to be deposited into such fund
